alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 10 at 4:21PM AKST until December 11 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Visibility reduced to one quarter mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 20 inches in town and 24 to 34 inches through Thompson Pass. For Thompson Pass, southeast winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Northeast Prince William Sound. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to noon AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Heavy snow and blowing snow will lead to white-out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will develop this evening then intensify tonight. The heaviest snow is expected overnight tonight through Monday morning. Snow could mix with rain in town Monday morning, but the bulk of precipitation will fall as snow. Additional snowfall is likely Monday afternoon through Tuesday with another storm system, but confidence is low for how much additional accumulation there will be and whether it will be warm enough to mix with or change to rain in town.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
